content: oh hey welcome back to the DMS craft I'm DM Scotty going to see here again what I
have planned for today on Episode three is a tile that I'm making for a
adventure of mine the player characters are trying to infiltrate an ogre
stronghold and it's an old Mormon fortress that the ogres have taken over
and there's an area with prisoners in it and the players will have an option of
climbing through the sewer to make a sneak attack and so I was going to
create that area and show you how I did it today so we'll get right to it
okay so I've already drawn out my room this is a standard figure so you can see
that this is a pretty big room I've pre-cut my square now you notice I have
two square rooms these are not two different rooms these are going to be
the same room so what I've got here is I've got a tile that I've drawn some
lines on and I've filled that in what I'm going to do is cut this out and then
these four pieces are going to glue onto this so this this part you'll see
through this these pieces into onto the bottom tile and in the center there is
where the drains going to be so basically the cages will be in the
corners and all the excrement and all that stuff
will drain off into the sewer and out of the fortress so unfortunately the
characters out to climb through that sludge so that won't be fun and as you
can see I've cut the wall strips so I can put those on the wall here and I'll
glue that on last now you'll notice - I want something I didn't mention before
is these wall strips are fairly thin so when you cut them you want to go against
the corrugation of cardboard so you can see there that the corrugation and if
you cut it along with the corrugation it won't have as much strength but if you
cut it with it you did these little strips will be very
strong and they will crunch up or rip up so that's something you definitely want
to do when you cut your strips and so I'll get the what we'll do now is I'll
cut this piece out and I'll show you how they fit together
okay now so now that I've cut these pieces out you can see a little better
how they go together see these are just the top layer and I cut out that so it
makes these channels where the waste can flow and that'll be the hole where the
players come through and then all the excrement and nasty stuff would go down
the sewer so I just cut these pieces out I cut the piece out that I had drawn on
there so then I got these all ready so now what I'll do is I'll glue these on
and I'll glue the walls on and we'll progress from there
alright I've got all the elements glued on this tile as you can see I've got the
walls going around and we did that on the first video so you can learn how to
do that I've got a door here that's where the entrance and exit that's where
the sewer will be and I glued a piece of card stock on the bottom there so that
covers that hole up they also notice something different on this tile that I
have it didn't show in the first video is I have interior walls so these
interior walls are going to be where the cells so these will be cells and I'm
going to have some bars going across and I'll show you how to do that later but
that's how you do interior walls just do do them the same as you would the
exterior wall just use the same stock and cut it the length you need and
you'll be all set so now I want to show you how I'm going to add the sludge and
waste that goes into this drain with my glue gun
so here I brought it in close you can see what I'm doing so I'm just taking
the glue gun and I've warmed it up and I'll pull the stand back so it's easier
to do and I'm just going to start squirting glue into the channel and then
just moving back and forth quickly and that will add some texture to that
channel it's kind of like what I did with the cave to add texture to the
rocks it's just going to add some texture to the to the look like sludge
that's going down there so we'll just finish up the entire
channel and then we'll be done and here's a little bit closer what it looks
like so you can see the detail so yeah so there you go that'll add a nice Chex
texture to that channel so as you can see we've done the texture
painting on the tile so it looks really good but now we're going to do some
details to make it pop like I've discussed in the other videos we're
going to do some dry brushing the dry brush the edges so I'm just going to use
some take my chisel brush and get some paint on there
not too much and we'll start picking out the edges and see how that pops out and
I've been a little bit in the channel but don't worry about that now because
we'll take care of that so if you picking out the edges and we'll finish
this up and we'll move on to the next step so now you can see I picked up the
edges so you can see those edges really pop out so now we're going to do shading
so basically it's a it's a it's the wet technique so we're going to get some
water on a brush get the paint pretty thin and then run around the edges
so pops out now you see that start to pop out I'm going to color that Center
in there pretty dark so I'm going to continue to pick out the edges and I've
got a color the chant one two and then we'll move on to the next so now I've
got the edges picked out you can see how those walls really pop out now so what
I'm going to do is I had colored the center square here but I'm going to
color the rest of the channel I'm going to keep it very wet so kind of the same
thing so here I'll start to color this channel
in you can see it's still pretty wet just fill right in and I'll do the rest
and we'll come back for the next step so it's very wet
okay as you can see I've colored the base black in there but now I'm going to
add some Brown because this is supposed to be a like where all the extra man and
waste from the cells goes so I'll give that a dark brown
I'll fill that in don't fill in that middle hole but just the channels now
while it's still wet I'm going to use a lighter brown and just add that so it
gives it a variation of tone and I've got two even light brown which I a
little bit of so that really starts to pop out and so
we'll finish that up and then we'll move on okay you can see we got the whole
tile going here we've got the channels painted with the nastiness a little bit
of brown on each on each of these cells this isn't a cell so these walls here
will complete the cells and I left the whole black so that looks like it's
going underneath this board section of there the players will crawl out of so
what we're going to do now is I'm going to let this dry and then I'll show you a
great embellishment to do to these channels here that will really make them
stand out and we'll come back with that now as you can see we go out of channels
painted in and the tile is looking really good
but there's one last technique that we can do that will make it even more
interesting the channels have the excrement and waste and sewage and stuff
in them so when the paint dries it will look flat it won't look very wet so what
we can do is use some water-based gloss and this is just what I like about the
water base is it's easy water cleanup you don't have to worry about all the
chemicals and mineral spirits and stuff so we'll just pop that open and we'll
paint in the channels so I'll get a plate to put that on and pop that open
so now I'll just dab it on and be careful you want to just get it in the
channel you don't want to get anywhere else and this will be nice in making the
channel look wet so it'll have that extra just bit of realism you can do
this with any kind of technique or with any tile that you have some kind of
liquid on and it works really well and like I say the water-based is nice
because you don't have to worry about the harsh chemicals to clean up
afterwards you just use soap and water to clean this brush off and you'll be
good to go for the next time and this jar will last you forever because you
know you're not going to be you're not painting that much so you'll have this
forever so one jar is really all you need so we just about got it done here
and once we have that done we'll let it dry now there's one thing we haven't
talked about and that's kind of like we have the cells here I'll move this we
have the cells here but no doors and then we have this exit here with no door
either so there are several options that you can do to fill those in and for the
next video will detail that and that's it that's your that your your prison
tile so we're all set and like I say next time we'll detail how to do the
cage bars and the door coming into the to the room so we'll see you next time
on the DMS craft DM scotty sign it off you
